content:
Check:
  all:
    - name: IDVARVAL
      operator: empty
    - name: USUBJID
      operator: empty
    - name: IDVAR
      operator: ends_with
      value: SEQ
Core:
  Id: CORE-000136
  Version: '1'
  Status: Published
Description: Raise an error when IDVARVAL and USUBJID are empty and IDVAR = Sequence
  Number.
Outcome:
  Message: IDVARVAL and USUBJID are not completed, but IDVAR equals Sequence Number.
  Output Variables:
    - RDOMAIN
    - IDVAR
    - IDVARVAL
    - RELID
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Record
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.4'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0201
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: This example shows how to use the RELREC dataset to
                  represent related information that is submitted as two datasets
                  that have a one-to-many relationship. in the example below  all
                  the records in one domain are being related to all of the records
                  in the other, so both  USUBJID and IDVARVAL are null.... Since IDVAR
                  identifies the keys that can be used to merge/join  records between
                  the datasets, --SEQ cannot be used because --SEQ only has meaning
                  within a subject within a dataset, not across datasets.
                Document: IG v3.4
                Section: 8.3.1 RELREC Dataset Relationship Example
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - RELATIONSHIP
  Domains:
    Include:
      - RELREC

json.Description: Raise an error when IDVARVAL and USUBJID are empty and IDVAR = Sequence Number.

Outcome.Message: IDVARVAL and USUBJID are not completed, but IDVAR equals Sequence Number.

Citations.Cited_Guidance: This example shows how to use the RELREC dataset to represent related information that is submitted as two datasets that have a one-to-many relationship. in the example below  all the records in one domain are being related to all of the records in the other, so both  USUBJID and IDVARVAL are null.... Since IDVAR identifies the keys that can be used to merge/join  records between the datasets, --SEQ cannot be used because --SEQ only has meaning within a subject within a dataset, not across datasets.
